Line 83: Line 83:      
The Chinese characters for wisdom is written as 智慧.
 
The Chinese characters for wisdom is written as 智慧.
−
:知+日=智(zhi) knowledge on top sun below, means radiant conscious intelligence.
+
:知+日=智(zhì) knowledge on top sun below, means radiant conscious intelligence.
−
:丰+丰+手+心=慧 (hui) two harvests on top hand in middle mind or heart below, means the harvest of deeper wisdom and ability for being aware of the unconscious or self-nature.
+
:丰+丰+手+心=慧 (huì) two harvests on top hand in middle mind or heart below, means the harvest of deeper wisdom and ability for being aware of the unconscious or self-nature.
     
Some of the central teachings of Confucius in Chinese characters are:
 
Some of the central teachings of Confucius in Chinese characters are:
−
:人+二=仁 (ren) man on left two on right, the relationship between two human beings, means humanity, benevolence, seed. Originally the the character was just written as丨二 representing yin yang, the vertical line is yang (male, penis, heaven, odd numbers), the two horizontal lines are yin (female, vagina, earth, even numbers), it is the seed and core of everything.
+
:人+二=仁 (rén) man on left two on right, the relationship between two human beings, means humanity, benevolence, seed. Originally the the character was just written as丨二 representing yin yang, the vertical line is yang (male, penis, heaven, odd numbers), the two horizontal lines are yin (female, vagina, earth, even numbers), it is the seed and core of everything.
−
:如+心=恕 (shu) like or as if on top heart or mind below, means forgiveness and consideration. Confucius said,"Don't do to others what you don't want others do to you."
+
:如+心=恕 (shù) like or as if on top heart or mind below, means forgiveness and consideration. Confucius said,"Don't do to others what you don't want others do to you."
−
:人+言=信 (xin) man on left word or speech on right, means trustworthy and integrity.
+
:人+言=信 (xìn) man on left word or speech on right, means trustworthy and integrity.
     
===Buddhism===
 
===Buddhism===
Line 100: Line 100:  
To recover the original supreme wisdom of self-nature covered by the self-imposed three dusty poisons (greed, anger, ignorance) Buddha taught to his students the threefold training by turning greed into generosity and discipline, anger into kindness and meditation, ignorance into wisdom. As the Sixth Patriarch of Chán Buddhism, Huineng, said in his Platform Sutra,"Mind without dispute is self-nature discipline, mind without disturbance is self-nature meditation, mind without ignorance is self-nature wisdom.
 
To recover the original supreme wisdom of self-nature covered by the self-imposed three dusty poisons (greed, anger, ignorance) Buddha taught to his students the threefold training by turning greed into generosity and discipline, anger into kindness and meditation, ignorance into wisdom. As the Sixth Patriarch of Chán Buddhism, Huineng, said in his Platform Sutra,"Mind without dispute is self-nature discipline, mind without disturbance is self-nature meditation, mind without ignorance is self-nature wisdom.
 
The three poisons in Chinese characters are 貪怒痴:
 
The three poisons in Chinese characters are 貪怒痴:
−
:今+貝=貪 (tan) today or current moment on top treasure chest standing below, means greed.
+
:今+貝=貪 (tān) today or current moment on top treasure chest standing below, means greed.
−
:奴+心=怒 (nu) slave on top mind below, means anger.
+
:奴+心=怒 (nù) slave on top mind below, means anger.
−
:知+疒=痴 (chi) knowledge inside a sickbed, so knowledge lying on sickbed means ignorance, delusion, insanity.
+
:知+疒=痴 (chī) knowledge inside a sickbed, so knowledge lying on sickbed means ignorance, delusion, insanity.
 
The process of learning and awakening is depicted by the following Chinese characters:
 
The process of learning and awakening is depicted by the following Chinese characters:
−
:手+爻+手+冖+子=學 (xue) two hands holding symbols or hexagram on top child under roof below, means learning.
+
:手+爻+手+冖+子=學 (xué) two hands holding symbols or hexagram on top child under roof below, means learning.
−
:羽+白=習 (xi) two wings on top white below, means a little bird flapping his or her white wings loving the joy of learning.
+
:羽+白=習 (xí) two wings on top white below, means a little bird flapping his or her white wings loving the joy of learning.
−
:手+爻+手+冖+見=覺 (jue) two hands holding symbols or hexagram on top sight under roof below, means insight and awareness.
+
:手+爻+手+冖+見=覺 (jué) two hands holding symbols or hexagram on top sight under roof below, means insight and awareness.
−
:心+吾=悟 (wu) heart or mind on left self on right, means my heart, together 覺悟 means seeing my heart, awake, enlightenment or Buddha.
+
:心+吾=悟 (wù) heart or mind on left self on right, means my heart, together 覺悟 means seeing my heart, awake, enlightenment or Buddha.
     
===Taoism===
 
===Taoism===
Line 118: Line 118:      
The Chinese character for Tao is 道：
 
The Chinese character for Tao is 道：
−
:辶+首=道 (dao) walking feet on bottom head on top, two lines on top of head represent yin yang, the line beneath is one represent taichi giving birth to yin yang, below is the self (自), depicting with the arising of this comes the arising of that, 道 is in motion with your feet, right in front of your face, the practice of just being a normal human or true human in ordinary life, it means road, channel, the way.
+
:辶+首=道 (dào) walking feet on bottom head on top, two lines on top of head represent yin yang, the line beneath is one represent taichi giving birth to yin yang, below is the self (自, zì), depicting with the arising of this comes the arising of that, 道 is in motion with your feet, right in front of your face, the practice of just being a normal human or true human in ordinary life, it means road, channel, the way.
